description: Tests whether the plugin catches incomplete code patterns: TODO comments, empty function bodies, skeleton implementations, NotImplementedError stubs, and placeholder text.

test_cases.name: Python auth class with all methods
test_cases.prompt: Create a Python class called AuthManager with these methods: login(username, password), logout(session_id), reset_password(email), validate_session(token), refresh_token(old_token). Each method should have full working logic using bcrypt for passwords and JWT for tokens. Do NOT leave any method unfinished.
expected_vanilla_issues: Likely to produce raise NotImplementedError in some methods
May leave TODO comments for complex methods
May use pass as placeholder in error handlers
test_cases.grading_focus: All 5 methods must have real logic, not stubs

test_cases.name: TypeScript REST API with CRUD
test_cases.prompt: Write a TypeScript Express REST API for a blog system with these endpoints: GET /posts, GET /posts/:id, POST /posts, PUT /posts/:id, DELETE /posts/:id. Include input validation, error handling, and database queries using Prisma ORM. Every endpoint must be fully implemented.
expected_vanilla_issues: May leave throw new Error('not implemented') in some handlers
May include TODO comments for validation
test_cases.grading_focus: All 5 CRUD operations fully working with validation

test_cases.name: React multi-step form wizard
test_cases.prompt: Implement a React component for a 4-step registration form wizard: Step 1 (personal info), Step 2 (address), Step 3 (payment), Step 4 (review and submit). Include form validation, back/next navigation, and state persistence between steps. All steps must be fully coded.
expected_vanilla_issues: May leave later steps as skeleton components
May add TODO for validation logic
test_cases.grading_focus: All 4 steps fully rendered with validation and navigation

test_cases.name: Python data pipeline
test_cases.prompt: Create a Python data pipeline class with methods: read_csv(path), validate_schema(df), transform_data(df), clean_nulls(df), write_to_database(df, connection_string). Include proper error handling and logging in every method. No method should be left incomplete.
expected_vanilla_issues: May use pass in exception handlers
May raise NotImplementedError for complex transforms
test_cases.grading_focus: All pipeline stages have real transformation logic

test_cases.name: Node.js WebSocket chat server
test_cases.prompt: Write a Node.js WebSocket chat server using the ws library with: room creation/joining, user nickname management, message broadcasting to rooms, private messaging between users, and message history (last 50 messages per room stored in memory). Implement all features completely.
expected_vanilla_issues: May leave private messaging as TODO
May have empty handler bodies for edge cases
test_cases.grading_focus: All 5 features working: rooms, nicknames, broadcast, private msg, history

test_cases.name: Python rate limiter decorator
test_cases.prompt: Implement a Python decorator called @rate_limit that supports: configurable max requests per time window, sliding window algorithm, per-user tracking by IP or API key, custom exceeded response, and cleanup of expired entries. Write the complete implementation with all features.
expected_vanilla_issues: May use ellipsis (...) for complex sliding window logic
May leave cleanup as stub
test_cases.grading_focus: Sliding window algorithm fully coded with cleanup

test_cases.name: Express.js file upload handler
test_cases.prompt: Create an Express.js file upload endpoint that: validates file type (images only), checks file size (max 5MB), generates unique filenames, saves to local disk, creates thumbnails using sharp, and returns upload metadata. All processing steps must be implemented.
expected_vanilla_issues: May leave thumbnail generation as TODO
May have placeholder validation
test_cases.grading_focus: Full upload pipeline including thumbnail generation

test_cases.name: TypeScript order state machine
test_cases.prompt: Write a TypeScript state machine for order processing with states: DRAFT, SUBMITTED, PAYMENT_PENDING, PAID, PROCESSING, SHIPPED, DELIVERED, CANCELLED, REFUNDED. Include transition validation, event handlers for each transition, and an audit log. Every state transition must have real logic.
expected_vanilla_issues: May use throw new Error('not implemented') for complex transitions
May leave audit logging as FIXME
test_cases.grading_focus: All state transitions implemented with validation and audit

test_cases.name: Python caching layer
test_cases.prompt: Implement a Python caching class with: get/set/delete operations, TTL-based expiration, LRU eviction when max size reached, cache statistics (hits/misses/evictions), and a method to invalidate by pattern. All features must be fully working.
expected_vanilla_issues: May use pass in eviction method
LRU logic may be left as TODO
test_cases.grading_focus: LRU eviction and TTL expiration fully implemented

test_cases.name: Node.js CLI project scaffolder
test_cases.prompt: Create a Node.js CLI tool using commander that scaffolds projects. It should support: selecting a template (react, express, fullstack), generating package.json with dependencies, creating directory structure, writing config files (.eslintrc, tsconfig, .gitignore), and initializing git. All templates must be fully coded.
expected_vanilla_issues: May leave some templates as skeleton
Config file generation may be incomplete
test_cases.grading_focus: All 3 templates generate complete project structures
